intro: Corydalis fedtschenkoana, commonly known as the snow lotus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold climates. Its tubular flowers are designed to attract specific pollinators, such as bees and flies. Due to its rarity and beauty, it is highly valued in horticulture and conservation efforts.
